page.title: 02Ropner Park
page.content: Ropner Park was opened in{1893}by the Duke and Duchess of York, who later became{King George V and Queen {Mary. }The land was given to the people of the town by Sir Robert Ropner. This park has facilities for people of all ages. There is an ornamental fountain. Ropner Park has a lake with a large variety of wildlife. There is an old stone fountain which is a memorial to John Dodshon. Ropner Park has a play area for children under thirteen, tennis courts and a bowling green. The park provides a peaceful, relaxing green area in the centre of Stockton.
